attachments.title: SF Cyclists To Protest Stopping At Stop Signs With ‘Stop-In’
attachments.text: A San Francisco bike group unhappy with a crackdown on cyclists who run stop signs is protesting the law by obeying it in critical mass style.
attachments.fallback: CBS San Francisco Link: SF Cyclists To Protest Stopping At Stop Signs With ‘Stop-In’

text: that's..a great idea. i wonder if it will backfire on them and traffic will actually be fine.
That sounds like an indictment of the wiggle route infrastructure more than bike stops
indeed. Though I have to agree with them that full stops are unnecessary for bikes. Seems like yielding is sufficient.
I forget where i saw it, but there was an article about how much energy a cyclist loses every time they do a full stop as opposed to a 5mph slowdown/yield
I think it was something like 300 feet of travel
